title: Lentil and Fennel Soup
introduction: Lentil and Fennel Soup is a delightful blend that showcases the versatility of lentils, one of the oldest legumes. This hearty Italian-inspired soup features the unique flavor of tiny green lentils from Castelluccio in Umbria and combines it with fresh fennel. Lentils do not require soaking, making this dish a convenient option for a nutritious and heartwarming meal.
ingredients: 1 pound brown or green lentils, picked over and rinsed
1 medium boiling potato, peeled and chopped
1 cup fresh or canned tomatoes, chopped
Salt and freshly ground black pepper
1 cup tubetti, ditalini, or small shells
instructions: In a large pot, combine the lentils, onions, carrots, potato, and fennel. Add cold water to cover by 1 inch. Bring the liquid to a simmer and cook over low heat for 30 minutes.

Stir in the tomatoes and olive oil. Add salt and pepper to taste. Cook until the lentils are tender, about 20 minutes more. Add a little water as needed so that the lentils are just covered with the liquid.

Stir in the pasta and cook until the pasta is tender, 15 minutes more. Taste and adjust seasoning. Garnish with the chopped fennel tops, if available. Serve hot or warm, with a drizzle of extra-virgin olive oil.
